results.title: Stachka = Strike (Musical soundtrack)
results.brief_description:
Eisenstein conceived his first film not as the portrayal of an actual historical event but as a generalised picture of a strike without individual heroes; the mass is a collective hero represented by types rather than characters.of poster-like sketches containing Eisenstein’s first experiments with montage both for direct emotional impact (collision) and for the presentation of abstract ideas (metaphor). A constructivist approach is evident in the way machinery is represented not as dominating the workers but as being enlisted by them in the struggle. Also available on VHS, LD and 16mm.

Credits: Director, Sergei Eisenstein ; photographer, E. Tisse, Vassili Khvatov ; [producer, Boris Mikhine ; script, Sergei Eisenstein, V. Pletniev, I. Kravtchunovsky, Grigori Alexandrov].
Cast: [Grigori Alexandrov, Maxim Strauch, Mikhail Gomarov], credited as Troupe of the workers Theatre.

results.title: Stabilizing soft sites
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how wet clay building sites can be cheaply and effectively stabilised by the addition of hydrated lime before building operations begin. This reduces expensive hold-ups due to bogged vehicles and the generally unpleasant conditions which prevail on a clay building site in winter.

results.title: St Paul's Cathedral
results.creator_credit: Merton Park and James E. Rogers
results.brief_description: A survey of London’s most famous cathedral, in itself a monument to Sir Christopher Wren. Its nave, central dome, whispering gallery, choir and high altar enshringe memorials to Nelson, Wellington, Gordon, Kitchener, and other famous men of the British Isles. Narrated by Robert Speaight,

results.title: St Kilda: the lonely islands
results.creator_credit: Films of Scotland and Christopher Mylne
results.brief_description: An evocation of the sense of timelessness which impresses itself on a visitor to this island in the Outer Hebrides. Depicts the unique fauna, and breathtaking beauty of the place, and shows the work of conservationists on the island.

results.title: St Barbe of the trees
results.creator_credit: M B Oldfield and Sons and Barrie Oldfield
results.brief_description: Presents 92 year-old Richard St Barbe Baker, the man who founded the international movement “Men of the Trees” in 1922, talking about trees: their life-giving qualities, the threats to them from disease and overfelling; and the need to plant for our lives. The first half of the film is scientific in approach while the second half becomes more lyrical with St Barbe reciting his favourite tree poems.

results.title: Squirrel-cage rotor principles
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
Laws of magnetism and induced electromagnetic fields.; electric flow in squirrel-cage rotor setting up magnetic poles which create torque; construction of squirrel-cage rotors.

results.title: Squeak the squirrel
results.creator_credit: Churchill-Wexler Film Productions and Lester F. Beck
results.brief_description: A baby squirrel is used in experiments to show how animals learn. He soon learns not to be afraid of people, finds how to get nuts out of glass tubes and out of boxes. He stuffs them in his cheek pouches and scurries off to hoard them in his nest.

results.title: Square pegs, round holes (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Helps young people understand individualism and the pressures of conformity by presenting an animated story about a cube who learns from its disappointments in trying to fit into round holes that being different is just as good as being the same.
